Articles.Content:
What is the highest altitude you can reach using just the KSP-5 engines that come in the Sunday punch pack, and the LT-20, LT-21, LT-30, LT-31, QS-80 decouplers , the SP-81C Quad-coupler and a parachute?

NOTE: This challenge requires the sunday punch pack: [glow=blue,2,300]http://www.kerbalspacerepository.com/tag/sunday-punch/[/glow]

Post screenshots of the flight results showing your highest altitude here.

NOTE: Your kerbals don\'t have to make it back alive.

EDIT: You can use an unlimited number of parts.

Kill ther kerbals and the the parachute float down on its own.

This is a spoiler!
You can also use any SAS Unit you want.
I reached an altitude of 11793.... But I forgot to screenshot... D:
Are struts allowed? This is WOBBLY rockets.

Put them in separate categories: struts and no struts. IIRC I hit something like 18k last night with no struts, orbit is doable I think (and if you can get orbit, escape velocity can\'t be far behind!), but I was distracted by shiny things before I completed the build.

and adding one more layer of boosters does almost nothing but get me past the tower, and bog down the computer. My high is 18699 when the speed hit 0. I might be able to tweak it a bit and get rid of some of the pieces (especially if I broke down and started using struts) but I doubt I\'d get much more altitude out of it.

I maanaged to get 21km but wasnt able to screenshot as Im in the development phase at the moment, Im running into some major controllability issues thanks to not being allowed to use fins If I can have fins I reckon I can make orbit.

20999 with no struts. I think it could be better with smarter staging.

Next stage of the layer-cake required struts. Got up to 47664 with that one.
